parts.name: Information
parts.info: This section goes into more detail on ways to customize GrimPack, as well as, some basic information, installation instructions, and more. Just click on a chapter to the side to read it.

pages.name: Info
pages.info:
The GrimPack contains a large amount of blocks, items, entities, world gen, and more. The pack is a conglomeration of all of the mods I (Grim3212) updated in the past. The Pack itself has versions back to 1.8.9 while all of the separate mods that this is made of may data back to 1.1.0. As of right now there are currently 7 parts to the pack. Each focusing on a specific set of blocks, items, or something else. Things are still being changed and added to GrimPack whenever I have some spare time. The Pack is very configurable and you disable parts or subparts for pretty much everything except a few things from Grim Core.
This website pulls all of it's information from the Instruction Manual so it follows the same order as it would appears in the manual. So, with each update this site will be updated with the new info and always be up-to-date. Pulling from the manual also means that if a language is translated then the website will have support for that language.

pages.name: Installation
pages.info: assets/grimpack/html/en_us/download.html

pages.name: W.I.P
pages.info:
Since the GrimPack is a combination of all of my old mods I am always trying to update some of the ones I haven't updated yet and add them into the pack. Depending on the mod it can be quite complex and take time where as some are very easy. I also have bugs to be fixed and requests come in. Sometimes they will interest me and I will try and add the ideas if they seem feasible.

The pack is always changing!!

I do not have time to work on this many separate mods so if I want to make something new it gets added as an option in the GrimPack. It takes time for things to happen so just be patient and see how the pack changes over time.

pages.name: Crafting Recipes
pages.info:
Crafting recipes in GrimPack will come in two variants. Shaped or Shapeless and this depends on the type of recipe. So, if it requires a certain pattern then 'Crafting Shaped' will appear under. If it can be put in any order then 'Crafting Shapeless. will appear under.
Crafting recipes also can contain ore dictionary items. If an input for a recipe accepts an oreDict entry there will be a GOLD glow around it and if you hover over the item the oreName will appear at the bottom of the tooltip.

pages.name: Furnace Recipes
pages.info: Furnace recipes will only contain an input and output. Place the item specified in the left side and you will get the item on the right side.

pages.name: Other Recipes
pages.info: There are also a few other recipes that are available right now but these are only for Machines. These follow the same rules as the furnace for getting the output. But some can contain oreNames just like with Crafting Recipes so look for the GOLD glow around an input and hover over it to see the oreName.

chapters.name: Configuration
chapters.info: We will not look at all the ways to modify the GrimPack to your liking. There are many ways to get to the config. One is in game go to mods, find GrimPack, and click on config. The other is it will be in your instance folder, in the config folder will be another folder labeled grimpack.

chapters.name: Resource Packs
chapters.info:
Resource Pack allow you to modify how Minecraft currently looks as well as other things like modifying recipes and sounds. GrimPack, like most mods, has support for this. Almost everything that normally is supported by a ResourcePack is supported in GrimPack except for a few exceptions.
More Information

pages.name: Looks & Sounds
pages.info:
Once you are familiar with how ResourcePacks work you can get started on changing the way blocks and items look. All items and blocks use vanilla's model system, except for SuperSlopes.
Super Slopes use 3D obj models. You can use Blender to edit or create new models. Also most Colorizer blocks don't explicitly set a texture since their texture is supposed to be dynamic. These models when designed should use 'tintindex' since they are supposed to be able to take on a blocks color as well.
There are a few sounds that are distributed with GrimPack. You should be able to change them as you would with any other sound. A list of sounds included can be found at here

pages.name: Recipes
pages.info: assets/grimpack/html/en_us/recipes.html

chapters.name: F.A.Q.
chapters.info:
• Can you update X? - No
  • Can I help? - Yes
  • When will you update? - No idea. I'll get around to it
  • The mod crashes, what do I do? - Make sure it is GrimPack's fault and report here
  • Can you help me with my mod? - No
  • Can I include this in a pack? - YES!
  • Can I do a mod review? - Sure, and send a link my way! :D

pages.name: About
pages.info:
The GrimPack is a combination of older mods that I updated in the past. There were many mods that I maintained separately. I started to run out of time and updating was a huge pain for over 30 mods. So, I decided to combine them into one pack to make it easier for me.
I started playing Minecraft in Beta 1.2_02. I started modding towards the end of Beta but released my first public mod for 1.1.0. Ever since then I have enjoyed making mods and keeping others ideas alive. GrimPack contains many Beta mods that were abandoned as well as newer abandoned mods. I have been the core developer of the separate mods as well as GrimPack. But we have had a few contributors.

parts.name: Grim Core
parts.info: The core part includes the Instruction Manual which provides info about blocks, items, and more in game. The core part also includes common blocks and items that are and can be used through out the Grim Pack.

pages.name: Users Guide
pages.info:
The instruction manual contains many different pages on the different parts that you currently have installed.
Recipe pages will, as the name suggests, display recipes. If a recipe is shapeless the output will be green and if a recipe contains ore dictionary items they will be yellow.
There are also furnace pages, info pages (like this one), and info and image pages. A mod can also add there own custom page types too.
You can also right click on entity's, blocks, and items in the world with the instruction manual to immediately open it up to that page. A green checkmark will appear next to the crosshair if it contains a manual page.

pages.name: Recipe
pages.info: The instruction manual is used to get all kinds of information about modded items and blocks.

chapters.name: Common Items
chapters.info: These common items can have uses throughout the entirety of the GrimPack. Some have many, some only a few, and some may not be used at all but rather use the ore dictionary for other mods.

pages.name: Iron Sticks
pages.info: The iron sticks are used in most tool recipes functioning as a more durable replacement for the stick.

pages.name: Coal Dust
pages.info: Coal dust is just a dust form of a piece of coal. Normally used to play a part in making metals.

pages.name: Graphite
pages.info: Graphite is a mineral of extremes and can have many uses.

pages.name: Graphite Rod
pages.info: Graphite can also be made into Graphite Rods which one use is in Nuclear development.

pages.name: Rubber
pages.info: Rubber is a flexible material and is very useful in many refined forms.

pages.name: Aluminum Ore
pages.info: Aluminum can be found naturally and can be transformed into ingots. Aluminum like iron has a wide range of uses.

pages.name: Aluminum Shaft
pages.info: Aluminum also has uses in a stick like form and can be crafted into an aluminum shaft.

pages.name: Aluminum Can
pages.info: Aluminum cans can be used to store fuel or crude oil and are one of the many uses of aluminum.

pages.name: Steel Ingots
pages.info: Steel is a more pure form of iron and is extremely durable.

pages.name: Steel Shaft
pages.info: Steel also has a shaft form which can be used in recipes. One recipe is building steel tools.

pages.name: Steel Block
pages.info: Like most materials steel has a condensed form which can go from block to item form.

pages.name: Generate Aluminum
pages.comment: True if aluminum ore should generate

parts.name: Grim Cuisine
parts.info: Adds many different types of food and health regeneration options.

pages.name: Recipes
pages.info: To get started creating any of the Soda types you will need to get carbonated water. You first need to get a Soda Bottle then Co2 and then you will have what you need to create Carbonated Water.

output.name: Soda Bottle
tooltip: Used to bottle your favorite soda

inputs.name: Soda Bottle
tooltip: Used to bottle your favorite soda

pages.name: Types
pages.info: Their are several different Soda types added which all heal you different amounts. The types available are Slurm-1.5H, Apple-5H, Golden Apple-10H, Cocoa-8H, Root Beer-2.5H, Diamond-10H, Mushroom-2.5H, Orange-4H, Orange Cream-4H, and Spiked Orange which hurts who drinks it.

output.name: Slurm
tooltip: Delicious ooze, I wonder where it comes from. Doesn't heal much

output.name: Golden Apple Soda
tooltip: One of the best tasting soda and the best for you

output.name: Spiked Orange Soda
tooltip: Give to those who did you wrong

output.name: Root Beer
tooltip: Tastes good but is not good for you

output.name: Diamond Soda
tooltip: One of the best sodas for you but tastes gross

output.name: Mushroom Soda
tooltip: Doesn't heal much and doesn't taste good

pages.name: Dragon Fruit
pages.info: Cacti now have a chance of dropping a new type of food which is Dragon Fruit and it replenishes 2 hunger.

pages.name: Recipes
pages.info: Sugar Sweets and Super Sugar Sweets are 'sweet'! The regular sweets replenish one hunger while the super sweets replenish 3. Just be careful you don't eat too much sugar.

pages.name: Recipes
pages.info: Health items are hard to come by. So, if you need to heal your wounds right away use these. The Bandage, Health Pack, and Super Health Pack which requires the Super Sugar from the previous sub-section. These can come in handy in battles because you won't have to wait for you hearts to slowly regenerate.

pages.name: Butter Churn Recipe
pages.info: The butter churn is very simple to use. Simply right click it with any milk bucket (including tools buckets) in your hand and then punch to get butter back out. Then eat butter!

pages.name: Cheese Maker Recipe
pages.info: The cheese maker is slightly more complex than the butter churn. Right click with any milk bucket (including tools buckets) in your hand and it will start processing. Wait for it to turn to a yellowish orange and then punch it and you get a block of cheese.

pages.name: Cheesey
pages.info: The block of cheese that you got from using the cheese maker can then be changed into 9 cheese pieces or vice versa.

pages.name: Sandwiches
pages.info: Using cheese you will be able to craft some yummy sandwiches. You can create bread slices used to create a filling cheese burger or a cheese sandwich.

pages.name: Making Eggs
pages.info: Using butter you will also be able to create some eggs which heal quite a bit back and are very filling. You will first have to crack and mix your eggs.

pages.name: Cooking Eggs
pages.info: Once mixed you can heat up your eggs and get them ready to eat. You don't want to be eating raw eggs.

pages.name: Pie Ingredients
pages.info: There are a few things you can and must make when baking pies. You will need dough and, as an optional filling, pumpkin slices.

pages.name: Preparation
pages.info: Before you can eat any pie you must make the empty pie and fill it with your choice of filling.

pages.name: Baking
pages.info: Once you bake your cake you can place it on a windowsill of your choice. Eat it like you would a cake!

pages.name: Cocoa Tree
pages.info: A new type of tree, the cocoa tree, will generate in your Minecraft world and can have cocoa fruit hanging down from it which is needed to craft some later things. You can also replant the cocoa fruit to generate some new cocoa trees.

pages.name: Cocoa Dust
pages.info: Using the cocoa fruit you can then create some cocoa dust.

pages.name: Dye
pages.info: Using cocoa dust you can also turn them into cocoa beans from vanilla by combining two of them.

pages.name: Chocolate Bowl
pages.info: You can now create a bowl of chocolate milk. This will need to be heated up to be used. You can use any milk bucket.

pages.name: Hot Chocolate Bowl
pages.info: To heat up the chocolate milk it will need to be put in a furnace. Now that it is heated up it will be able to be used in the chocolate mould and also in some other recipes.

pages.name: Balls
pages.info: Using the bowl of hot chocolate milk we now create balls of chocolate which can be eaten.

pages.name: Cake
pages.info: Using the chocolate balls and any form of milk you can create chocolate cakes which are quite delicious.

pages.name: Chocolate Mould
pages.info: To get started in crafting some chocolate bars you will need to make a chocolate mould. It is pretty easy to craft and all you need to do to start the chocolate bar process is right click on it with a bowl of hot chocolate milk. Once the chocolate is hardened give it a punch and get your chocolate bars. If ice or snow is under the mould then the process will be two times faster.

pages.name: Storage
pages.info: The chocolate bars that you just created can be eaten or you can craft them to store a lot of them at once or if you would like them back you get 9 back from storage.

pages.name: Bars
pages.info: To craft a legitimate candy bar you will need to craft a wrapper first. THen using that wrapper and a regular chocolate bar you can create a wrapped chocolate bar. Using the power of a wrapper this can be eaten and is a better food then plain chocolate bars.

parts.name: Grim Decor
parts.info: Adds in many different decorative items and blocks to spice up your Minecraft world.

pages.name: Info
pages.info:
Did you need more options to decorate your house or other buildings with.
This gives you that ability. This adds furniture like chairs, tables, and stools, to a more expanded range of fences to choose from. Many types of fireplaces calendars and more for you to find out.
Many of the blocks added allow for an almost unlimited range using many of the blocks around you.

pages.name: Mossy Cobblestone
pages.info: Furniture that involve mossy cobblestone looks nice but mossy stone is hard to come by. As a result a recipe has been added to compensate.

pages.name: Stone
pages.info: One of the new blocks that this mod adds is Fancy Stone which looks quite nice. Fancy Stone can also be converted back into stone if you like.

pages.name: Roads
pages.info: A Road block, which looks better then gravel, allows for you to quickly travel through the world by increasing your walking speed (similar to industries sidewalk). Try not to break an ankle.

pages.name: Calendar
pages.info: Need to know how long you've been in your Minecraft world or when to get more porkchops. If you do then the calendar will help keep track of those things for you.

pages.name: Clock
pages.info: If you also would like to display the current time on the wall then use a wall clock.

pages.name: Wallpaper Info
pages.info:
Are your walls lacking substance? Maybe they need some wallpaper. Wallpaper gives you many options to decorate your home with. By default you have 24 different designs.
Other than just the default wallpaper you can also dye them by right clicking on a placed wallpaper with dye, if you would like to clear the wallpaper use Bonemeal.
If your house even catches on fire remember that you can remove the burned look from wallpaper.

pages.name: Wallpaper
pages.info: Once placed right click on it again and it will cycle through the available options. When placed next to other wallpaper it will try and take on the texture of the surrounding wallpaper.

pages.name: Frame Info
pages.info:
If you would also like to add depth to your house then frames are for you. Frames come in either wood or iron.
Frames are stronger then wallpaper so if their supporting block is removed they will still be there. To dye a frame you just need to right click with a dye in your hand on them. To break frames use an axe for wooden and a pickaxe for the iron.

pages.name: Frame
pages.info: Similar to wallpaper, once placed keep right clicking for available patterns.

pages.name: Flat Item Frame
pages.info: These "flat item frames" act exactly like regular item frames except that you can also place them on the top and bottom of blocks. These are slightly more expensive than regular item frames.

pages.name: Neon Sign
pages.info: Neon Signs work just like regular signs except colored text will glow and it has a fancy GUI to get the text to look just the way you want it. It also comes with three different backgrounds.

pages.name: Cages
pages.info: Cages and chains to give off a dark or even evil feel. If you have a caught Pokeball you can place it in the cage to display your catch.

pages.name: Lanterns
pages.info: If you ever found torches a bit bland then lanterns will come in handy. These include bone, iron, and paper lanterns.

pages.name: Decorations
pages.info: Their are 3 basic crafts, the bone and clay crafts and the clay pot. The bone craft is ready after you are done crafting it and once placed right clicking it will cycle through various display types. The Unfired Clay Decoration and the Uncooked Clay Pot will need to be put into a furnace to be completed.

pages.name: Firing Clay
pages.info: Uncooked decorations will need to be fired to use. Both blocks when right clicked, after placed, will switch through different display types. As you switch display types the pot will be able to support those type of plants on top. Also something special happens when a pot is placed on a stool.

pages.name: Light Bulbs
pages.info: Besides lanterns, light bulbs can be made to feel more modern. They can be controlled by redstone and are placed underneath blocks. When broken you receive glass shards which can be crafted back into glass.

pages.name: Fluro Tubes
pages.info: Fluro tubes are fluorescent blocks that give off a strong light and are available in one of the 16 Minecraft colors.

pages.name: Illumination Tubes
pages.info: Illumination tubes are another bright light source similar to torches except they can be placed on any side of a block and are nice and sleek.

pages.name: Alarms
pages.info: Alarms are blocks that when powered with redstone emit an *alarming* sound... You can change which sound is played with a GUI.

pages.name: Colorizer
pages.info: Any block crafted with colorizer inherits it's properties and allows for it to take on the texture of other blocks. These blocks include all the furniture, lamp posts, and fireplace blocks.

pages.name: Brush
pages.info: Once a colorizer block has changed to a block you will not be able to change it again without breaking it. Unless you have the brush which with a right click can remove the stored block and with shift right click will tell you what is stored.

pages.name: Tables
pages.info: Tables are part of some of the new furniture. Tables when placed to one another automatically place the legs at the correct positions for a table so you can have enough room to eat your cereal.

pages.name: Chairs
pages.info: Chairs go with your tables. These chairs re-orient depending on which way you place them.

pages.name: Stools
pages.info: Stools are smaller than chairs and go quite well when a clay pot is placed on top of them.

pages.name: Counters
pages.info: Counters are like the tables except without the legs so they just kinda float there.

pages.name: Doors
pages.info: You can also colorize doors to hide entrances to your base or just make something classy.

pages.name: Trap Doors
pages.info: You can also colorize trap doors so that you can have another way to hide an entrance but without breaking the look of the floor.

pages.name: Fences
pages.info: Fences are like regular fences except they do not attach to vanilla fences but do attach to the new fence gates added. There is also some overlap with the fences already in Minecraft.

pages.name: Fence Gates
pages.info: Fence Gates act like vanilla gates but do not connect to vanilla fences but fancy packs fences.

pages.name: Walls
pages.info: Walls are basically counters but on their side and these like chairs re-orient depending on the direction they were placed from.

pages.name: Burning Wood
pages.info: To be able to have fireplaces burn indefinitely a netherrack infused wood will need to be constructed. This allows the fire never to run out.

pages.name: Fireplace
pages.info: Fireplaces when right clicked with Flint and Steel burns and provides light, punch to put it out. Chimneys produce smoke when on top of a lit fireplace. Fireplaces also re-orient their corner posts when multiple are placed next to each other.

pages.name: Chimney
pages.info: Chimneys produce smoke when placed on top of either a Fireplace or Stove and can be stacked on top of each other.

pages.name: Stove
pages.info: Stoves, like fireplaces, when right clicked with Flint and Steel lights up with fire and you can punch it to put it out. Chimneys produce smoke when on top of a lit stove.

pages.name: Firepit
pages.info: Firepits when right clicked with Flint and Steel lights up with fire and you can punch it to put it out. Firepits can also have a protective net around them.

pages.name: Firering
pages.info: Firerings are great for ghost stories. Firerings when right clicked with Flint and Steel lights up with fire and you can punch it to put it out.

pages.name: Recipe
pages.info: Want to cook some burgers for you and your friends on a grill. You will first need to add coal or charcoal into the fuel slot then light the grill with Flint and Steel and then place in the food you want to cook.

pages.name: Recipes
pages.info: Lamp Post are crafted like so and once placed form a 3 block high structure. Only the top block emits light.

pages.name: Info
pages.info: All of the following blocks work the same as colorizers in which they can take on the texture of other blocks by right clicking them with the block. Some of these blocks allow for rotation while all of the blocks can be flipped upside down in the same way half slabs and stairs can be. Simply place them on the upper half of a block. Almost all of these blocks can be used as an alternative to stairs.

pages.name: Slopes
pages.info: Slopes are half of a full block and operate the same as straight stairs.

pages.name: Sloped Angles
pages.info: Sloped angles can be walk up only on the point that is facing.

pages.name: Slanted Corners
pages.info: Slanted corners are a sharper incline the sloped angles but can still be walked up.

pages.name: Corners
pages.info: Corners are a sideways cut of a full block.

pages.name: Oblique Slopes
pages.info: Oblique slopes act as a corner piece on stairs and are basically missing a slanted corner.

pages.name: Sloped Intersections
pages.info: Sloped intersections are what would happen if two slopes were combined and act as corner stairs.

pages.name: Stairs
pages.info: These have all the same functionality as regular stairs but can be textured like any of the other colorizer blocks.

pages.name: Pyramids
pages.info: Pyramids only count as half a block. Can be acquired as leaves using the pruners on a large pyramid.

pages.name: Large Pyramids
pages.info: Large pyramids can be climbed up but the highest point is in the middle as you would suspect. Can be acquired as leaves using the pruners on a sloped post.

pages.name: Sloped Posts
pages.info: Sloped post can not be climbed up. These blocks can also be found as leaves if you use the pruners on any leaf block.

pages.name: Pillar
pages.info: Pillars are simple colorizeable blocks that can be placed at all angles and are just a large post.

pages.name: Pruners
pages.info: Pruners are used to convert leaf blocks into sloped posts, then large pyramids, and finally pyramids. You can right click on a leaf block to cycle through these modes and shift right click to flip them upside down.

parts.name: Grim Industry
parts.info: Adds a bunch of tech stuff.

pages.name: Recipes
pages.info: The two new Workbenches added are made out of Iron and Diamond. The Iron will double your output from crafting and the Diamond will quadruple the output.

pages.name: Portability
pages.info: The two new Workbenches can also be made portable just like the regular portable workbench from tools.

pages.name: Crates
pages.info: Crates allow you to store a single chests worth of items but can also be locked to keep your items safe.

pages.name: Cabinets
pages.info: Cabinets are similar to the warehouse crates where they store a single chests worth of items and can be locked but they come in two varieties and open from the front instead of the top.

pages.name: Safes
pages.info: The obsidian safe is very strong and resistant and is similar to crates and cabinets. The gold safe can only hold 9 different stacks but can be broken and placed down while storing the items inside.

pages.name: Lockers
pages.info: Lockers can be placed either one or two high. When placed two high you can access twice the items. Similar to a double chest but on it's side.

pages.name: Item Towers
pages.info: Item Towers are an interesting way of storing your items. Each one can store 18 stacks in two rows. But when stacked on top of each other you can access all of them from the one you open.

pages.name: Lock and Key
pages.info: Locks and keys can be made that when right clicked on any storage option except item towers then they will be locked unless you have the key with the correct combo. You will need a locksmith workbench to set the lock.

pages.name: Locksmith Workbench
pages.info: A locksmith workbench can be used to set the lock for locks and keys. Put a lock or key in the right, type a lock in the middle and the output will contain your newly set lock or key.

pages.name: Fluid Tanks
pages.info: Besides item storage there is also a very basic way to store any type of liquid, the tank. This block can store 8 buckets worth of a liquid but make sure to drain it before breaking!

pages.name: Toggle Rack
pages.info: The Toggle Rack block when powered by redstone spawns fire above the block and when powered indirectly too. This is pretty much the same as the Elemental fire block.

pages.name: Fire
pages.info: This elemental block when activated by redstone spawns fire above the block, when deactivated the fire gets removed.

pages.name: Water
pages.info: This elemental block when activated by redstone spawns a block of water above the block, when deactivated the water gets removed.

pages.name: Lava
pages.info: This elemental block when activated by redstone spawns a block of lava above the block, when deactivated the lava gets removed.

pages.name: Recipe
pages.info: Spikes can be placed on all 6 sides of a block and can be controlled by redstone. When active they deal a large amount of damage and when inactive they shrink into the ground and do no damage.

pages.name: Recipe
pages.info: Fans are directional blocks that can either blow (push) or suck (pull) entities. You can right click to open a GUI where they are configurable for range and modes. Also when activated with redstone they turn off.

pages.name: Recipe
pages.info: Extruders once built can be placed in the world. They are used to help mine and build for you. Right click to give them fuel and optionally give them building materials. Give them a punch and they will get to work.

pages.name: Info
pages.info:
After an extruder is activated it will start travelling forward in whatever direction it was facing. It will try and mine any blocks in front of it and place blocks from the extruder inventory row underneath the fuel slot.
For fuel you can use any sticks, coal, redstone, lava buckets, blaze rods, and magma cream. Some of these give speed boosts or slows it down. By default magma cream is the fastest then redstone, while coal and sticks make it go slower and the rest do not change the speed.
Each time it mines a block or places a block extra fuel is consumed. When trying to make an extruder build something you can place obsidian to make it reset the current position in the row back to the front.

pages.name: Recipes
pages.info: Their are 4 different sensors added, Wood, Stone, Iron, and Netherrack. The Wood detects all entities, the Stone detects all living entities, the Iron detects only the player, and the Netherrack detects all hostile entities. A red light will appear if an entity is detected and then it will emit a redstone signal.

pages.name: GPS
pages.info: If you need to find the coordinates of a certain point then you can use the GPS. Simply right click on a block and it tells you the coordinates of the point offset by the side of the block you hit. You need a GPS to set the specific sensors.

pages.name: How to Sense
pages.info:
Using specific sensors allows you to detect all types of entities. They have 3 different modes Player, Mob, Item. With player it will detect any player entities or you can set a player name for it to detect.
With Mob it will detect all living entities or you can specify the mob name (ex. Zombie). If the name is red it doesn't exist.
Finally Item mode detects only thrown Items. If you want it to detect only specific items click set item and then click an item in your inventory.

pages.name: How to Sense Part 2
pages.info:
There is just a bit more information for Specific Sensors. To set the position of the sensors you can right click with a GPS that has coordinates or click set position and click on a gps in your inventory. The position you choose cannot be covered by a block and a green message will tell you if it is a good position.
You can give yourself an indicator of the position you have chosen by clicking in the top right corner Show Sensor Box in World.
Finally, for the upgraded specific sensors you can click on more options to change the size of the box. The box has a maximum of 5 and supports fractional values.

pages.name: Specific Sensor
pages.info: The base specific sensor does not allow for customizing the box it checks for and has a range of 6 blocks away from the sensor.

pages.name: Upgraded Specific
pages.info: The Upgraded Specific Sensor is a more powerful version that has a larger range as well as you can customize the size of the box you are sensing.

pages.name: Arrow Sensor
pages.info: This block will emit a redstone pulse when it is hit with an arrow. The arrow will then pop off and be able to be picked up.

pages.name: Fire Sensor
pages.info: The fire sensor will look below it for fire and if it is detected then it will emit a redstone signal until the fire is put out.

pages.name: Boots
pages.info: Gravity Boots are made so that while wearing them you will not be effected by any of the different blocks when they are active. So you will be able to freely move around.

pages.name: Controllers
pages.info: There are two different types of gravity controllers. The Low Gravity Controller will reduce gravity to allow you to jump higher. The regular Gravity Controller will make all entities start to float upward into the sky (including you unless you have Gravity Boots). All entities that fly will take fall damage if they get high enough. Right click to activate.

pages.name: Attractors
pages.info: Their are two types of attractors the regular Attractor and the Directional Attractor. When powered the regular Attractor will start to pull in entities around it with a range of 12 blocks. The Directional Attractor is different because only the side with the attractor end will attract entities.

pages.name: Gravitors
pages.info: Their are two types of gravitors the regular Gravitor and the Directional Gravitor. When powered the regular Gravitor will start to make entities around it float into the air. The Directional Gravitor is different because only the side with the gravitor end will make entities float into the air.

pages.name: Repulsors
pages.info: Their are two types of repulsors the regular Repulsor and the Directional Repulsor. When powered the regular Repulsor will start to push entities away with a range of 12 blocks. The Directional Repulsor is different because only the side with the repulsor end will push entities.

pages.name: Mob Repulsor
pages.info: The mob repulsor is a portable item that makes all hostile mobs do their very best to get out of your way. Passive mobs, players and items are not affected. Gravity boots are not required. Right click to activate.

pages.name: Uranium Ore
pages.info: Uranium Ore can be found naturally below the surface in small clusters but if you are in old chunks or you just want to craft some their is a recipe. But be careful because it will hurt you when mining it unless you have a radiation suit.

pages.name: Anti-Radiation Suit
pages.info: If you are planning on mining some uranium you will want an Anti-Radiation Suit so you won't take any damage while working with it.

pages.name: Uranium Ingots
pages.info: Once you have your Uranium ore you will want to get the ore from it by smelting the ore.

pages.name: Refining Uranium
pages.info: Uranium ingots only use is to refine it into Refined Uranium. Refined Uranium will come in handy later.

pages.name: Plutonium
pages.info: Now using that Refined Uranium you can create Plutonium Ingots again which will be used later.

pages.name: Refined Plutonium
pages.info: Like Uranium Ingots, Plutonium's only use is to be refined into Refined Plutonium.

pages.name: Reactor Core
pages.info: You now have your unstable materials ready for creating a reactor core which is used for the creation of a Nuclear Reactor.

pages.name: Reactor Core Case
pages.info: To house you Reactor Core you will need casing which is made out of Graphite Rods.

pages.name: Iron Parts
pages.info: The final parts needed before you can create a Nuclear Reactor is Iron Parts.

pages.name: Nuclear Reactor
pages.info: Finally you have all of the parts necessary for creating a Nuclear Reactor. The Nuclear Reactor is needed for the creation of a Nuclear Bomb and if you right click on it you can have it emit a redstone signal, right click again to turn it off.

pages.name: Bomb Shells
pages.info: Bomb Shells are needed to house the explosives themselves.

pages.name: C4
pages.info: C4 is the first explosive added which is stronger than TNT. C4 does explode immediately once activated with redstone unlike TNT.

pages.name: Nuclear Bomb
pages.info: The second explosive added is a Nuclear Bomb. The Nuclear Bomb is stronger than both TNT and C4 and makes a huge explosion once activated with redstone. Once activated it explodes immediately like C4. Enjoy!

pages.name: Shaped Charges
pages.info: A shaped charge will instantly mine the blocks below it until it hits a block that it can't mine.

pages.name: Shaped Charge - Radius
pages.info: Shaped Charges are also able to be improved with a larger radius. Be warned the larger the radius the more it can lag out your game!

pages.name: Castle Gate
pages.info: Castle gates when placed will place more gate blocks until they reach the ground. They can be retracted when paired with the Gate Trumpet.

pages.name: Gate Trumpet
pages.info: The Gate Trumpet is used to retract Castle Gates, just right click in the area of a Castle Gate and it will retract all gate blocks that are in the area.

pages.name: Garage Door
pages.info: Garage Doors are like Castle Gates that once placed they will place more garage blocks until they reach the ground. They can be retracted with the Garage Remote.

pages.name: Garage Remote
pages.info: The Garage Remote is used to retract Garage Doors, like Gate Trumpets just right click in the area of a Garage Door.

pages.name: Halogen Lights
pages.info: Halogen Lights can be placed on all 6 sides of a block and emit light. THey look more modern than torches.

pages.name: Halogen Torches
pages.info: Halogen Torches are basically Minecraft torches but with a more modern look and a bit brighter.

pages.name: Sidewalk
pages.info: Sidewalk blocks are added in this mod which add a small speedboost when walking on them

pages.name: Tarball
pages.info: Tarballs are needed for the construction of rways.

pages.name: Asphalt
pages.info: Asphalt is created from tarballs and is used to create the top of the rways.

pages.name: RWays
pages.info: Their are 3 types of rways. The basic rways which can later be modified, light rways that can emit light when active, and manhole rways which when right clicked you can pass through the block.

pages.name: Doors
pages.info: Their are 3 doors added with Modern Tech (Chain, Glass, and Steel). All doors are like regular doors and can be opened with your hand.

pages.name: Various Blocks
pages.info: Three various blocks that are added are chain link fences which are like Iron Bars, a Fountain which will emit water particles when right clicked with your hand, and a Camo Pressure Plate which takes on the texture of the block underneath it.

pages.name: Decoration Blocks
pages.info: Some random decoration blocks are concrete, Horizontal Siding, and Vertical Siding. Horizontal and Vertical Siding are special because their base color can change when paired with the Paint Rollers from the next page.

pages.name: Paint
pages.info: Their are four types of paint rollers, white, red, green, and blue. They are used to paint the Horizontal and Vertical Siding blocks. Just right click the blocks to paint them. All of the paint rollers can go back to the original Paint Roller by putting it in a crafting table with a Bucket of Water.

pages.name: Paint
pages.info: Their are four types of paint rollers, white, red, green, and blue. They are used to paint the Horizontal and Vertical Siding blocks. Just right click the blocks to paint them. All of the paint rollers can go back to the original Paint Roller by putting it in a crafting table with a Bucket of Water.

pages.name: More Aluminium
pages.info: Some other things that you can create out of aluminium are Buckets and Ladders.

pages.name: Coal Iron
pages.info: To get started on getting steel you will need to create some Coal-Dusted Iron. These are crafted from coal dust and iron ingots as shown below.

pages.name: Steel Ingots
pages.info: Steel Ingots are created from the Coal-Dusted Iron and then putting them in a Furnace.

pages.name: Steel Stuff
pages.info: Like aluminium their are some items that will be used later like the Steel Shafts and Pipes. Their is also options for you to store your steel and to create a Steel Frame Block (which will be useful if I update the Heavy Vehicles part).

pages.name: Steel Tools
pages.info: Also added in this mod is a full set of Steel Tools which are as good as Iron.

pages.name: Metal Mesh
pages.info: This block allows items to pass through it freely while stopping the player and mobs.

pages.name: Info
pages.info:
Before you are able to craft any of the machines you will need to have made some steel. This is the main material in crafting of the machines.
Also a Modern Furnace requires you to have Fuel for it to be powered. So you will have to have made an oil derrick and refinery before you can get a modern furnace.

pages.name: Refinery
pages.info: To start refining to get fuel you will need the Refinery.

pages.name: Refinery Recipes
pages.info: Using the refinery you can refine oil to fuel as well as purify some materials. Everything that you can do with the refinery is shown below.

pages.name: Derrick
pages.info: Another machine added is the Oil Derrick. The Oil Derrick can extract oil from the Black Gold Ore itself. To start using just place it on the ore, it can't be placed anywhere else. Then put some Aluminium Cans in and it will start slowly extracting crude oil.

pages.name: Derrick Recipes
pages.info: The Oil Derrick's only use is to fill aluminum cans with oil.

pages.name: Fuel
pages.info: To power the Modern Furnace you will need Fuel. Fuel can't be crafted but needs to be refined and to get something to refine you can craft Super Crude Oil which is made from Oily Chunks and Aluminium Cans. You can get oily chunks from mining Black Gold Ore which is another ore that is randomly generated.

pages.name: Modern Furnace
pages.info: The Modern Furnace is like a regular furnace but runs off of Fuel and is also faster.

pages.name: Modern Furnace Recipes
pages.info: The Modern Furnace can smelt anything that the vanilla furnace can as well as blocks and items that you can only get using the Modern Furnace, these are shown below.

pages.name: Drill
pages.info: Drills provide a quick way to mine down to layer 5. These can be placed and then right clicked and it will start mining. You may also place an inventory on the top to collect drops.

pages.name: Conveyor Belts
pages.info: Conveyor Belts allow you to transport items and entities along a certain path. Items will make sure to stay in the middle of the block so they don't fall off.

pages.name: Recipes
pages.info: Using a bucket of water you will be able to create ice using the Ice Maker. Once crafted right click on the Ice Maker with a Bowl of Water and the water will start the freezing process give it some time and once done it will have the texture of ice on top. Punch it to get your ice.

pages.name: Flip Flop
pages.info: Flip Flop Torches work as the flip flop logic gate. Give it power in the off state and it will be powered until it receives another source of power.

pages.name: Glowstone
pages.info: Glowstone torches give off light when powered, just like Redstone Lamps. But, you are able to walk through these and they behave like regular torches.

pages.name: Laser
pages.info: Laser Bridges are basic bridges that can't be broken, these can be walked on and if you right click a block on the Laser Bridge Control the lasers will take the texture of that block. Shift Right Click with an empty hand to reset. Give it a redstone signal to shoot the laser. These have a max distance set in the config and will also stop at any non-replaceable block. (Green Laser)

pages.name: Acceleration
pages.info: Accel Bridges work just like Laser Bridges and when you walk on these you get a speed boost. (Red Laser)

pages.name: Trick
pages.info: Trick Bridges look and behave exactly like Laser Bridges in every way except that you cannot walk on these and will fall right through them. (Yellow Laser)

pages.name: Death
pages.info: Death Bridges look and behave exactly like Trick Bridges in every way and if any entity comes into contact with a laser it will hurt them. (Red Laser)

pages.name: Gravity Lift
pages.info: Gravity Lift's shoot out like all the other Bridges except these you can walk into and you will get pushed in the direction it is facing. These are different than other Bridges because they will stop if they come into contact with another Gravity Lift.

pages.name: industryGeneralCfg
pages.comment: This is just general industry options.

children.name: Damage from Uranium Ore
children.comment: Determines the amount of damage taken from trying to mine Uranium

children.name: Do workbench upgrades double result
children.comment: True if upgraded workbenches should give you double or quadruple the result

children.name: Generate Oil Ore
children.comment: True if oil ore should generate

children.name: Generate Uranium
children.comment: True if Uranium ore should generate

children.name: Maximum Bridge Length
children.comment: Maximum Bridge Length.tooltip

children.name: Return Default Recipe If Listed
children.comment: If true then if a block or item is either blacklisted or not on a whitelist then it will return the default crafting recipe.

children.name: Show Fan Particles
children.comment: True if you want fans to generate the air particles.

children.name: Workbench black or white list
children.comment: These are where you will find either the whitelisted or blacklisted items and blocks that can be crafted and doubled using an iron or diamond workbench. You can specify mod:name (ex: grimpack:black_diamond) or mod:name:meta (ex: minecraft:wool:3).

children.name: Workbench whitelist else blacklist
children.comment: If true then the workbench is in whitelist mode so all items listed are the only ones that can be crafted. But if false then blacklist mode will allow all items and blocks to be crafted except those listed in 'Workbench black or white list' config list.

children.name: Modern Furnace Fuels
children.comment: Use this to add new modern furnace fuels. \nTo add a new fuel add a line then write out the [RawItemName] separated by a '>' then write out the [BurnTime]. For mod items make sure to add the modID with a colon ':' and the then the item name. \nExample: grimpack:fuel>25000

pages.name: industryExtruderCfg
pages.comment: You can most of how the extruder works by changing the options here.

children.name: Coal speed modifier
children.comment: How much faster the Extruder will move with coal. This can make it slower if below 1

children.name: Extruder move speed
children.comment: How fast the extruder moves by default

children.name: Fuel per blazerod
children.comment: How much fuel a blazerod provides the Extruder

children.name: Fuel per coal
children.comment: How much fuel a piece of coal provides the Extruder

children.name: Fuel per extruded block
children.comment: How much fuel it costs for each block to be extruder (or placed)

children.name: Fuel per lava
children.comment: How much fuel a bucket of lava provides the Extruder

children.name: Fuel per magma cream
children.comment: How much fuel magma cream provides the Extruder

children.name: Fuel per mined block
children.comment: How much fuel it costs to mine each block

children.name: Fuel per redstone
children.comment: How much fuel a piece of redstone provides the Extruder

children.name: Fuel per stick
children.comment: How much fuel a stick provides the Extruder

children.name: Magmacream speed modifier
children.comment: How much faster the Extruder will move with magmacream. This can make it slower if below 1

children.name: Redstone speed modifier
children.comment: How much faster the Extruder will move with redstone. This can make it slower if below 1

children.name: Stick speed modifier
children.comment: How much faster the Extruder will move with a stick. This can make it slower if below 1

parts.name: Grim Tools
parts.info: Adds a bunch of weapons and useful tools.

pages.name: Recipe
pages.info: You can craft backpacks which have 18 slots to store items. Also you cannot put backpacks into backpacks to make an infinite amount of space.

pages.name: Dying
pages.info: You can also dye backpacks with any dyes and they will save your items. If you no longer wan them dyed you can use a bucket of water to wash them back to the default leather look.

pages.name: Recipe
pages.info: You use the portable workbench just like a regular workbench except you can take it with you and use it while in your inventory.

pages.name: Ore
pages.info: Black Diamond ore can be found deep in the ground and spawns in a cluster about the size of diamond but far less common.

pages.name: Smelting
pages.info: Once you have found and mined some black diamond to get the actually gem from the ore you need to smelt the ore.

pages.name: Crafting
pages.info: You are also able to compact black diamonds in the same way you can with regular diamonds.

pages.name: Toolset
pages.info: Using black diamonds you can craft a full tool set, all of which are better then diamond tools.

pages.name: Armor
pages.info: Along with the full tool set you can also craft a full set of armor from black diamonds.

pages.name: Wooden Bucket
pages.info: Use sticks to craft a wooden bucket. This bucket can pick up only water and milk cows. When used to place back down it turns into 3 sticks as well as when crafting a cake.

pages.name: Stone Bucket
pages.info: Use cobblestone to craft a stone bucket. This bucket can pick up water, lava and milk cows but when used it is turned back into 3 cobblestone.

pages.name: Golden Bucket
pages.info: Use gold ingots to craft a gold bucket. This bucket can pick up water, lava and milk cows. This bucket does not break when used and can also store up to 4 buckets of the liquid stored.

pages.name: Diamond Bucket
pages.info: Use diamonds to craft a diamond bucket. This bucket can pick up water, lava and milk both cows and sheep. This bucket does not break when used and can store up to 16 buckets of the liquid stored.

pages.name: Obsidian Bucket
pages.info: Use obsidian to craft a obsidian bucket. This bucket can pick up water, lava, and fire. It can also milk cows, sheep, and pigs. This bucket does not break when used and can store up to 32 buckets of the type of blocks stored. You can also use this bucket to place water in the Nether.

pages.name: Milk Bucket
pages.info: All buckets allow for milking and can be used in any recipe requiring a milk bucket. You can also drink milk buckets to clear potion effects. Milk buckets do stack and will react accordingly to drinking and when crafted.

pages.name: Grip
pages.info: Ballistic knives, throwing knives, and tomahawks all require a good grip.

pages.name: Spring
pages.info: The spring part is needed to craft an empty ballistic knife and is used to push the blade out.

pages.name: Button
pages.info: The button part is needed to craft an empty ballistic knife and used to trigger the spring.

pages.name: Ballistics
pages.info: Combine all of the parts to create the Empty Ballistic Knife.

pages.name: Knife
pages.info: You create the knives separately and to load the Ballistic Knife simply right click with it in your hand while knives are in your inventory. These knives are specially design for the Ballistic.

pages.name: Throwing Knife
pages.info: To use simply right click while holding the item and when it hits should do quite a bit of damage.

pages.name: Tomahawk
pages.info: This is how to craft the tomahawk. Like using the throwing knives just right click while holding it and it will be thrown.

pages.name: Wooden
pages.info: Wooden boomerangs can be thrown with right click and will go once it hits it's maximum distance it will return to you.

pages.name: Diamond
pages.info: Diamond boomerangs by default can be thrown farther and do more damage to entities. They work exactly like wooden ones but can be changed to be able to follow where you are looking.

pages.name: Types
pages.info: You can craft either an iron or diamond chisel which both can work on all the ores in the vanilla game. The iron chisel has 32 uses while the diamond chisel has 128.

pages.name: Ores
pages.info: To stop unlimited amounts of gold and iron instead of receiving the blocks back when using the chisel you item ore versions which smelt to get the same outcome.

pages.name: Recipe
pages.info: The extinguisher can be helpful in saving your house from lava or fire. The extinguisher has one use and on right click it extinguishes the player, and removes all fire and lava around you.

pages.name: Refilling
pages.info: After using the extinguisher you may want to refill it so a simple recipe can help you out with that.

pages.name: Recipes
pages.info: Hammers are new tools that on use will destroy the block in one hit but not drop the items. So if you have a huge mountain of dirt to get rid of this will be very helpful.

pages.name: Base
pages.info: Their are machetes with the base items that regular Minecraft tools use. Machetes are used to hurt mobs but also can help when breaking leaves, webs, cloth, vines, and cactus.

pages.name: Slime
pages.info: Another machete added is the Slime Machete. THe slime machete is like the other machetes and has the same stats as the Iron Machete. But, the slime machete also can knock back enemies (slightly random which direction that they knock back).

pages.name: How To Use
pages.info:
This mod adds 3 types of Magic Wands (Building Wands, Mining Wands, and Breaking Wands).
Each wand type has its own special modes that do special things based on key combinations. To see a wands modes press the Left_Control by default. It will display the mode and the key combination needed, all keys displayed are configurable.
To get started right click a block and click on another block with the key combination pressed and the mode chosen should happen. Their are also a few other things in the mods config that change different things.
Go experiment and have fun! :D

pages.name: Basic Wands
pages.info: These are the 3 types of regular wands available. The Breaking Wand for destruction. The Mining Wand helps mine. The Building Wand helps you build.

pages.name: reinforced Wands
pages.info: These are the 3 types of reinforced wands available. These wands allow you to work more by giving the wands more uses as well as adding extras to the possible options.

pages.name: Recipes
pages.info: Their are 6 different tool materials. The 5 vanilla ones and obsidian. Each tool has the abilities of all the tools they are made out of.

pages.name: Recipe
pages.info: Pokeballs are amazing items that when thrown and hit a mob capture the mob inside. When thrown again the mob will be released. Be aware these do not tame the mob and that this saves the mobs data when captured and will be released exactly as before.

pages.name: Powerstaff
pages.info: The powerstaff can move blocks. It has four different modes which can be switched with the mode key, M by default. Push mode pushes blocks forward and pull mode pulls blocks backward. If in float mode blocks do not have gravity applied to them and can be suspended in space. The player can 'ride' the block. In dropping mode gravity is applied. This makes blocks behave like gravel or sand.

pages.name: Neptune Staff
pages.info: The Neptune Staff gives a player the ability to freeze mobs, freeze water, or place water out of thin air. Holding certain keys while right clicking can give different results as well as if you are clicking on a block or in air. Press help key (default: Left_Ctrl) to view key combos.

pages.name: Phoenix Staff
pages.info: The Phoenix Staff gives a player the ability to thaw mobs, thaw water, and place lava or fire out of thin air. Holding certain keys while right clicking can give different results as well as if you are clicking on a block or in air. Press help key (default: Left_Ctrl) to view key combos.

pages.name: Element 115
pages.info: Element 115 can be found in ground around your world. When mined it will drop the item form of Element 115 which is used as ammo for the Rayguns and as part of the recipe for the Advanced Raygun.

pages.name: Canisters
pages.info: To use the Basic Raygun you will need ammo. The ammo is stored in canisters which you fill with Element 115.

pages.name: Raygun
pages.info: The Raygun uses the ammo crafted on the previous page. To shoot the Raygun you right click and you will get an empty canister back. The Raygun is quite powerful so be careful what you shoot.

pages.name: Dark Iron
pages.info: Dark Iron is needed as a component of the Advanced Raygun ammo and the gun itself. Dark Iron is made out of Iron and Element 115 from the previous chapter.

pages.name: Advanced Canisters
pages.info: Like the Basic Raygun the advanced raygun needs ammo. Since the Advanced Raygun is stronger it needs more powerful ammo.

pages.name: Advanced Raygun
pages.info: The Advanced Raygun is a more powerful version of the Basic Raygun. It uses stronger ammo and also fires a different color of ray. Like the Basic Raygun you right click to shoot and will recieve an Empty Advanced Canister back.

pages.name: Pellets
pages.info: The ammo used with the Slingshot are Slingshot Pellets. There are many different types including stone, iron, netherrack, light, fire, and explosion. Stone, iron and netherrack just do basic damage. Light places a torch, fire lights stuff on fire, and explosion causes an explosion but it only hurts entities.

pages.name: Sling Shot
pages.info: The slingshot can use many different types of ammo. It doesn't have to reload and can be fired very quickly. To switch ammo types by default press M and it will give you information on what mode you are in. This can fire using pellets found in your inventory and in pellet bags.

pages.name: Pellet Bag
pages.info: The pellet bag can hold only pellets and instead of storing pellets in your inventory and taking up space you can put pellets in this bag and it can fire from the bag.

pages.name: Basic Spears
pages.info: The 3 basic types of spears are Flint, Iron, and Diamond Spears. They don't do anything beyond damaging entities by either throwing or hit entities.

pages.name: Special Spears
pages.info: The 5 types of special spears are Explosive, Fire, Slime, Light, and Lightning Spears. The Explosive, Fire, Light, and Lightning Spears cause a special effect where they land. The Explosive causes an explosion, the Fire sets on fire, the Light places a torch, and the Lightning causes a lightning strike. The Slime Spear bounces where it lands.

pages.name: Grenades
pages.info: The Grenade Launcher allows you to launch an explosive grenade that when it hits something will explode. Just right click with grenades in your inventory.

pages.name: Recipe
pages.info: The Ultimate Fist is a weapon and a tool that is very over-powered. The damage that it deals is configurable but starts out being able to one hit an Ender Dragon. The tool aspect by default is able to insta-mine blocks but, like the weapon part how fast it mines is also configurable.

pages.name: Empty Mask
pages.info: To get started creating mob masks you will need an empty mask. The empty mask can be worn.

pages.name: Mob Masks
pages.info: These are all mob masks. All of these masks can be worn as helmet and can be used to scare people.

pages.name: Recipes
pages.info: The Chicken Suit is a unique armor set. With every piece of the suit you get an extra jump. With these you can 'fly' around as good as a chicken.

pages.name: Recipes
pages.info: Currently there are three detonators. Simple right click a detonator to throw it and wait until the fuse burns and it explodes. The Thermal Detonator breaks blocks and spawns fire. The Solar Detonator only hurts entities. Finally, the Nukeulator causes a massive explosion.

parts.name: Grim Util
parts.info: Adds in a bunch of utilities to enhance your Minecraft.

pages.name: Info
pages.info: Instead of having to go into your inventory and get another tool or more blocks out this mod automatically replaces the blocks or items when you run out. It works with most things except for a few exceptions like buckets.

pages.name: Info
pages.info: AutoTorch allows you to automatically place torches while walking around. If the block light level you're standing on gets below a certain threshold then you will place a torch. You can modify these values in the autotorch config section.

pages.name: Info
pages.info: (By Default) Pressing Z will make you do a FusRoDah shout from Skyrim which when used fires a blast that will fling entities into the air. The key to use it is configurable as is the upward and forward pushing force, and options to have sound played when used and two different sounds to choose form.

pages.name: Info
pages.info: Adds a toggleable display that shows the time. This is activated by default using the G key but can be changed in the options.

pages.name: Info
pages.info: When you die a Grave is created so that your items won't be lost. This grave will appear at your death location and will contain all of your items as well as current experience level. The headstone will contain your name, the date, and time of death. You can right click and open the gui or break to get everything back.

pages.name: Info
pages.info: All doors, trapdoors, and fence gates can be opened with only one right click instead of multiple depending on the setup. Doors work when they are side-by-side trapdoors work up to 3x2 area and fence gates work when two or more are stacked on top of each other.

pages.name: Info
pages.info: Infinite Lava changes how lava works so that it is able to be produced infinitely like water. All you need is two buckets of lava to make an infinite pool of lava.

parts.name: Grim World
parts.info: Adds in world generation and entities and some awesome fungus!

pages.name: Info
pages.info: Randomite has a chance to drop any of the ores in Minecraft and even an egg.

pages.name: Info
pages.info: This mod changes how bedrock generates and instead of being really crazy and uneven this mod flattens it out into one layer.

pages.name: Info
pages.info: Desert Wells changes the way natural Desert Wells spawn in. They add varied depth and also loot to them so it gives you a reason to explore them.

pages.name: Info
pages.info: Ice Pixie are annoying little guys found in snowy environments. The Ice Pixie will attack players but cannot be hurt by players. It can only be hurt when surrounded by torches.

pages.name: Info
pages.info: Treasure Chests can be found wandering around. When killed it has a chance to drop a variety of different items from bread to diamonds.

pages.name: Info
pages.info: World Gen Expanded adds in many new world generation features. It generates melons, wheat patches, stumps and saplings and cactus fields and sandstone pillars in Deserts. All generation can be configured if they spawn and how frequent they spawn.

pages.name: Info
pages.info: Corruption block will start to 'corrupt' your world by converting everything to the Nether. It transforms other blocks surrounding it with a block of netherrack, soul sand, or another corruption block. It can also spawn fires which is configurable and the block is only obtainable from the nether.

pages.name: Info
pages.info: This mod adds the ability to generate floating islands in your minecraft world. Their are config options for size variance and frequency and also one to turn off generation.

pages.name: Notch
pages.info: Notch holds a Diamond Sword and when attacked will attack you. He also drops apples.

pages.name: Farmer
pages.info: The farmer roams around and will attack if you attack it. They hold a Wooden Hoe and can drop wheat when killed.

pages.name: Lumberjack
pages.info: The lumberjack roams around and holds a Wooden Axe. He will also attack you if you attack him and he has a chance of dropping wood and sticks.

pages.name: Miner
pages.info: The miner holds a Stone Pickaxe and will also attack you if you attack him. He has a chance of dropping coal when killed.

pages.name: Psychopath
pages.info: The psychopath has no arms and will attack you on sight. He will not drop anything if killed.

pages.name: Suicide Bomber
pages.info: The suicide bomber will run at you and attack you and when attacked he will explode.

pages.name: Recipes
pages.info: Gunpowder Reeds naturally generate around the world but if you would like to get started right away you can craft them yourself. They are like vanilla reeds in that they must be next to water and only grow 3 high. They also must be planted on dirt or sand.

pages.name: Recipe
pages.info: Glowstone seeds are a way to farm glowstone. Seeds need to be planted under netherrack since they grow upside down and can be planted in the Nether or 15 blocks above Bedrock. They grow very, very slowly but once grown they grow a group of glowstone similar to the ones found naturally in the Nether.

pages.name: Parabuzzy
pages.info: This creature hovers above the ground and really likes fish. It can be tamed, be put on your head (where it can heal), as well as comes in a variety of types. Some say these guys can also help reduce fall damage.

pages.name: Bob-omb
pages.info: Using this item you can create a Bob-omb these guys will give their lives to save you from harm. Just be careful that you aren't in the blast radius. These guys can also be placed on your head.

pages.name: Green Fungi
pages.info: Green fungi will be needed to make any of the colored fungi. All basic fungi doesn't really have a purpose except to grow and keep growing unless boxed in. Basic fungi will replace liquid and weak blocks. Breaking fungi with your hand can drop a slimeball, using a sword will drop the block itself. Basic Fungi have two types the normal and rapid, rapid grows faster.

pages.name: Colored Fungi
pages.info: Colored fungi are just colored versions of the green variety. Grows unless enclosed, replaces liquid and weak blocks, breaking fungus with a hand can drop a slimeball, breaking them with a sword, shears, or silk touch drops the block itself, and their are two types normal and rapid which rapid grows faster. The colors to choose from are RED, GREEN, BLUE, PURPLE, YELLOW, ORANGE, PINK, CYAN.

pages.name: Building Fungi
pages.info: Building Fungi as the name suggests build different types of blocks. THese include block builders which build blocks as they grow but will not grow higher than you placed the blocks. Layer builders build a flat layer of the block specified. And liquid builder are just block builders but for lava and water. Building blocks include Netherrack, Sand, Dirt, Stone, Cobble, StoneBricks, SandStone, Glass.

pages.name: Maze Fungi
pages.info: An experimental builder is the maze builder which when placed will start to build a maze. Like the other building fungi it will not grow upward but only down and to the sides.

pages.name: Acid Fungi
pages.info: Acid fungi are fungi that kill other fungi their are two types the regular and the rapid. One is all you need for a big group of fungi.

pages.name: Block Eaters
pages.info: Another variety of fungus are the block eaters which eat a certain type of block by replacing the blocks they eat with themselves. The eater types are Stone, Rock, Dirt, Sand/Gravel, Leaves/Water, and one to target Forests. All eater types are configurable for which types of blocks they eat.

pages.name: Vert Block Eaters
pages.info: A sub-species of the Block Eaters are the vertical eaters which instead of growing in any direction will not grow any lower than where they were placed. All eater types are configurable for which types of blocks they eat.

pages.name: Recipe
pages.info: Fungicide is used if you want to remove large amounts of fungi in an area at once. Once crafted it has unlimited uses and has a range of up to 20 blocks. Just right click and particles will appear in the area that you cleared.

pages.name: Runes
pages.info: Runes are magical blocks that bestow the players with 'powers'. They are fairly rare and can only be found in ruins.

pages.name: Rune Effects
pages.info:
Each rune can bestow the player with a certain effect. Below are the effects for the currently discovered 16 Rune types. Runes can be divided into two groups based on if there effect is a positive or negative (usually).
lnPositives:r 3URr - Strength, 3HAGELr - Jump Boost, 3EOLHr - Resistance, 3CENr - Fire Resistance, 3GERr - Haste, 3RADr - Speed, 3BEORCr - Regeneration, 3LAGUr - Water Breathing, 3ODALr - Night Vision
lnNegatives:r dEOHr - Poison, dISr - Slowness, dDAEGr - Instant Health, dTYRr - Nausea, dNYDr - Hunger, dTHORNr - Weakness, dOSr - Blindness

pages.name: Fountains
pages.info: Fountains can be large structures that generate in the water. They can contain spawners and rare loot.

pages.name: Pyramids
pages.info: Pyramids are large structures that have started to decay over the years. Most have many levels but can be very rewarding.

pages.name: Ruins
pages.info: Ruins are remnants of a past civilization. Ruins have decayed greatly over the years but can still contain treasures of old.

pages.name: Snowballs
pages.info: Snowballs are massive snow and ice structures. They closely resemble massive snowmen.

pages.name: Water Domes
pages.info: Water Domes are structures found on the bottom of the ocean that can contain Runes as well as some rare ones are made of uncommon materials.

pages.name: Spires
pages.info: Spires are natural structures that reach towards the sky. These can contain runes as well as very rarely be 'death spires'.
